alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:37AM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... River Raisin At Monroe City affecting Monroe County. For the River Raisin...including Tecumseh, Adrian, Blissfield, Dundee, Monroe City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...River Raisin at Monroe City. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
